00057 /**
00058  * Handle representing a connection to ccnd
00059  */
00060 struct ccn {
00061     int sock;
00062     size_t outbufindex;
00063     struct ccn_charbuf *connect_type;   /* text representing connection to ccnd */
00064     struct ccn_charbuf *interestbuf;
00065     struct ccn_charbuf *inbuf;
00066     struct ccn_charbuf *outbuf;
00067     struct ccn_charbuf *ccndid;
00068     struct hashtb *interests_by_prefix;
00069     struct hashtb *interest_filters;
00070     struct ccn_skeleton_decoder decoder;
00071     struct ccn_indexbuf *scratch_indexbuf;
00072     struct hashtb *keys;    /* public keys, by pubid */
00073     struct hashtb *keystores;   /* unlocked private keys */
00074     struct ccn_charbuf *default_pubid;
00075     struct ccn_schedule *schedule;
00076     struct timeval now;
00077     int timeout;
00078     int refresh_us;
00079     int err;                    /* pos => errno value, neg => other */
00080     int errline;
00081     int verbose_error;
00082     int tap;
00083     int running;
00084     int defer_verification;     /* Client wants to do its own verification */
00085 };

00087 struct interests_by_prefix { /* keyed by components of name prefix */
00088     struct expressed_interest *list;
00089 };

00091 struct expressed_interest {
00092     int magic;                   /* for sanity checking */
00093     struct timeval lasttime;     /* time most recently expressed */
00094     struct ccn_closure *action;  /* handler for incoming content */
00095     unsigned char *interest_msg; /* the interest message as sent */
00096     size_t size;                 /* its size in bytes */
00097     int target;                  /* how many we want outstanding (0 or 1) */
00098     int outstanding;             /* number currently outstanding (0 or 1) */
00099     int lifetime_us;             /* interest lifetime in microseconds */
00100     struct ccn_charbuf *wanted_pub; /* waiting for this pub to arrive */
00101     struct expressed_interest *next; /* link to next in list */
00102 };
00103 
00104 /**
00105  * Data field for entries in the interest_filters hash table
00106  */
00107 struct interest_filter { /* keyed by components of name */
00108     struct ccn_closure *action;
00109     struct ccn_reg_closure *ccn_reg_closure;
00110     struct timeval expiry;       /* Time that refresh will be needed */
00111     int flags;
00112 };
00113 #define CCN_FORW_WAITING_CCNDID (1<<30)

00116     struct ccn_closure action;
00117     struct interest_filter *interest_filter; /* Backlink */

00145 /**
00146  * Compare two timvals
00147  */
00148 static int
00149 tv_earlier(const struct timeval *a, const struct timeval *b)
00150 {
00151     if (a->tv_sec > b->tv_sec)
00152         return(0);
00153     if (a->tv_sec < b->tv_sec)
00154         return(1);
00155     return(a->tv_usec < b->tv_usec);
00156 }

00158 /**
00159  * Produce message on standard error output describing the last
00160  * error encountered during a call using the given handle.
00161  * @param h is the ccn handle - may not be NULL.
00162  * @param s is a client-supplied message; if NULL a message will be supplied
00163  *        where available.
00164  */
00165 void
00166 ccn_perror(struct ccn *h, const char *s)
00167 {
00168     const char *dlm = ": ";
00169     if (s == NULL) {
00170         if (h->err > 0)
00171             s = strerror(h->err);
00172         else
00173             dlm = s = "";
00174     }
00175     // XXX - time stamp
00176     fprintf(stderr, "ccn_client.c:%d[%d] - error %d%s%s\n",
00177                         h->errline, (int)getpid(), h->err, dlm, s);
00178 }
00179 
00180 static int
00181 ccn_note_err(struct ccn *h)
00182 {
00183     if (h->verbose_error)
00184         ccn_perror(h, NULL);
00185     return(-1);
00186 }

00188 /**
00189  * Set the error code in a ccn handle.
00190  * @param h is the ccn handle - may be NULL.
00191  * @param error_code is the code to set.
00192  * @returns -1 in all cases.
00193  */
00194 int
00195 ccn_seterror(struct ccn *h, int error_code)
00196 {
00197     if (h == NULL)
00198         return(-1);
00199     h->err = error_code;
00200     h->errline = 0;
00201     if (error_code != 0)
00202         ccn_note_err(h);
00203     return(-1);
00204 }

00209  * @returns the most recently set error code, or 0 if h is NULL.

00211 int
00212 ccn_geterror(struct ccn *h)
00213 {
00214     if (h == NULL)
00215         return(0);
00216     return(h->err);

00240 /**
00241  * Do the refcount updating for closure instances on assignment
00242  *
00243  * When the refcount drops to 0, the closure is told to finalize itself.
00244  */
00245 static void
00246 ccn_replace_handler(struct ccn *h,
00247                     struct ccn_closure **dstp,
00248                     struct ccn_closure *src)
00249 {
00250     struct ccn_closure *old = *dstp;
00251     if (src == old)
00252         return;
00253     if (src != NULL)
00254         src->refcount++;
00255     *dstp = src;
00256     if (old != NULL && (--(old->refcount)) == 0) {
00257         struct ccn_upcall_info info = { 0 };
00258         info.h = h;
00259         (old->p)(old, CCN_UPCALL_FINAL, &info);
00260     }
00261 }
00262 
00263 /**
00264  * Create a client handle.
00265  * The new handle is not yet connected.
00266  * On error, returns NULL and sets errno.
00267  * Errors: ENOMEM
00268  */
00269 struct ccn *
00270 ccn_create(void)
00271 {
00272     struct ccn *h;
00273     const char *s;
00274     struct hashtb_param param = {0};
00275 
00276     h = calloc(1, sizeof(*h));
00277     if (h == NULL)
00278         return(h);
00279     param.finalize_data = h;
00280     h->sock = -1;
00281     h->interestbuf = ccn_charbuf_create();
00282     param.finalize = &finalize_pkey;
00283     h->keys = hashtb_create(sizeof(struct ccn_pkey *), &param);
00284     param.finalize = &finalize_keystore;
00285     h->keystores = hashtb_create(sizeof(struct ccn_keystore *), &param);
00286     s = getenv("CCN_DEBUG");
00287     h->verbose_error = (s != NULL && s[0] != 0);
00288     s = getenv("CCN_TAP");
00289     if (s != NULL && s[0] != 0) {
00290     char tap_name[255];
00291     struct timeval tv;
00292     gettimeofday(&tv, NULL);
00293         if (snprintf(tap_name, 255, "%s-%d-%d-%d", s, (int)getpid(),
00294                      (int)tv.tv_sec, (int)tv.tv_usec) >= 255) {
00295             fprintf(stderr, "CCN_TAP path is too long: %s\n", s);
00296         } else {
00297             h->tap = open(tap_name, O_WRONLY|O_APPEND|O_CREAT, S_IRWXU);
00298             if (h->tap == -1) {
00299                 NOTE_ERRNO(h);
00300                 ccn_perror(h, "Unable to open CCN_TAP file");
00301             }
00302             else
00303                 fprintf(stderr, "CCN_TAP writing to %s\n", tap_name);
00304         }
00305     } else
00306         h->tap = -1;
00307     h->defer_verification = 0;
00308     OpenSSL_add_all_algorithms();
00309     return(h);
00310 }
00311 
00312 /**
00313  * Tell the library to defer verification.
00314  *
00315  * For some specialized applications (performance testing being an example),
00316  * the normal verification done within the library may be undesirable.
00317  * Setting the "defer validation" flag will cause the library to pass content
00318  * to the application without attempting to verify it. In this case,
00319  * the CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_RAW upcall kind will be passed instead of
00320  * CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT, and CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_KEYMISSING instead of
00321  * CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_UNVERIFIED.  If the application wants do still do
00322  * key fetches, it may use the CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_FETCHKEY response instead
00323  * of CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_VERIFY.
00324  *
00325  * Calling this while there are interests outstanding is not recommended.
00326  *
00327  * This call is available beginning with CCN_API_VERSION 4004.
00328  *
00329  * @param defer is 0 to verify, 1 to defer, -1 to leave unchanged.
00330  * @returns previous value, or -1 in case of error.
00331  */
00332 int
00333 ccn_defer_verification(struct ccn *h, int defer)
00334 {
00335     int old;
00336 
00337     if (h == NULL || defer > 1 || defer < -1)
00338         return(-1);
00339     old = h->defer_verification;
00340     if (defer >= 0)
00341         h->defer_verification = defer;
00342     return(old);
00343 }
00344 
00345 /**
00346  * Connect to local ccnd.
00347  * @param h is a ccn library handle
00348  * @param name is the name of the unix-domain socket to connect to,
00349  *      or the string "tcp[4|6][:port]" to indicate a TCP connection
00350  *      using either IPv4 (default) or IPv6 on the optional port;
00351  *      use NULL to get the default, which is affected by the
00352  *      environment variables CCN_LOCAL_TRANSPORT, interpreted as is name,
00353  *      and CCN_LOCAL_PORT if there is no port specified,
00354  *      or CCN_LOCAL_SOCKNAME and CCN_LOCAL_PORT.
00355  * @returns the fd for the connection, or -1 for error.
00356  */
00357 int
00358 ccn_connect(struct ccn *h, const char *name)
00359 {
00360     struct sockaddr_storage sockaddr = {0};
00361     struct sockaddr_un *un_addr = (struct sockaddr_un *)&sockaddr;
00362     struct sockaddr_in *in_addr = (struct sockaddr_in *)&sockaddr;
00363     struct sockaddr_in6 *in6_addr = (struct sockaddr_in6 *)&sockaddr;
00364     struct sockaddr *addr = (struct sockaddr *)&sockaddr;
00365     int addr_size;
00366     int res;
00367 #ifndef CCN_LOCAL_TCP
00368     const char *s;
00369 #endif
00370     if (h == NULL)
00371         return(-1);
00372     h->err = 0;
00373     if (h->sock != -1)
00374         return(NOTE_ERR(h, EINVAL));
00375 #ifdef CCN_LOCAL_TCP
00376     res = ccn_setup_sockaddr_in("tcp", addr, sizeof(sockaddr));
00377 #else
00378     if (name != NULL && name[0] != 0) {
00379         if (strncasecmp(name, "tcp", 3) == 0) {
00380             res = ccn_setup_sockaddr_in(name, addr, sizeof(sockaddr));
00381             if (res == -1)
00382                 return(NOTE_ERR(h, EINVAL));
00383         } else {
00384             un_addr->sun_family = AF_UNIX;
00385             strncpy(un_addr->sun_path, name, sizeof(un_addr->sun_path));
00386         }
00387         ccn_set_connect_type(h, name);
00388     } else {
00389         s = getenv("CCN_LOCAL_TRANSPORT");
00390         if (s != NULL && strncasecmp(s, "tcp", 3) == 0) {
00391             res = ccn_setup_sockaddr_in(s, addr, sizeof(sockaddr));
00392             if (res == -1)
00393                 return(NOTE_ERR(h, EINVAL));
00394             ccn_set_connect_type(h, s);
00395         } else if (s == NULL || strcasecmp(s, "unix")) {
00396             ccn_setup_sockaddr_un(NULL, un_addr);
00397             ccn_set_connect_type(h, un_addr->sun_path);
00398         } else {
00399             return(NOTE_ERR(h, EINVAL));
00400         }
00401     }
00402 #endif
00403     h->sock = socket(sockaddr.ss_family, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
00404     if (h->sock == -1)
00405         return(NOTE_ERRNO(h));
00406     switch (sockaddr.ss_family) {
00407         case AF_UNIX: addr_size = sizeof(*un_addr); break;
00408         case AF_INET: addr_size = sizeof(*in_addr); break;
00409         case AF_INET6: addr_size = sizeof(*in6_addr); break;
00410         default: addr_size = 0;
00411     }
00412     res = connect(h->sock, addr, addr_size);
00413     if (res == -1)
00414         return(NOTE_ERRNO(h));
00415     res = fcntl(h->sock, F_SETFL, O_NONBLOCK);
00416     if (res == -1)
00417         return(NOTE_ERRNO(h));
00418     return(h->sock);
00419 }

00428 void
00429 ccn_set_connect_type(struct ccn *h, const char *name)
00430 {
00431     if (h->connect_type == NULL) {
00432         h->connect_type = ccn_charbuf_create();
00433     } else {
00434         ccn_charbuf_reset(h->connect_type);
00435     }
00436     ccn_charbuf_append_string(h->connect_type, name);
00437 }
00438 
00439 const char *
00440 ccn_get_connect_type(struct ccn *h)
00441 {
00442     if (h->connect_type == NULL || h->connect_type->length == 0)
00443         return (NULL);
00444     return (ccn_charbuf_as_string(h->connect_type));
00445 }
00446 
00447 int
00448 ccn_disconnect(struct ccn *h)
00449 {
00450     int res;
00451     res = ccn_pushout(h);
00452     if (res == 1) {
00453         res = fcntl(h->sock, F_SETFL, 0); /* clear O_NONBLOCK */
00454         if (res == 0)
00455             ccn_pushout(h);
00456     }
00457     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->inbuf);
00458     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->outbuf);
00459     /* a stored ccndid may no longer be valid */
00460     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->ccndid);
00461     /* all interest filters expire */
00462     if (h->interest_filters != NULL) {
00463         struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
00464         struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
00465         for (hashtb_start(h->interest_filters, e); e->data != NULL; hashtb_next(e)) {
00466             struct interest_filter *i = e->data;
00467             i->expiry = h->now;
00468         }
00469         hashtb_end(e);
00470     }
00471     /* all pending interests are no longer outstanding */
00472     if (h->interests_by_prefix != NULL) {
00473         struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
00474         struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
00475         for (hashtb_start(h->interests_by_prefix, e); e->data != NULL; hashtb_next(e)) {
00476             struct interests_by_prefix *entry = e->data;
00477             if (entry->list != NULL) {
00478                 struct expressed_interest *ie;
00479                 for (ie = entry->list; ie != NULL; ie = ie->next) {
00480                     ie->outstanding = 0;                
00481                 }
00482             }
00483         }
00484         hashtb_end(e);
00485     }
00486 
00487     res = close(h->sock);
00488     h->sock = -1;
00489     if (res == -1)
00490         return(NOTE_ERRNO(h));
00491     return(0);
00492 }
00493 
00494 static void
00495 ccn_gripe(struct expressed_interest *i)
00496 {
00497     fprintf(stderr, "BOTCH - (struct expressed_interest *)%p has bad magic value\n", (void *)i);
00498 }
00499 
00500 static void
00501 replace_interest_msg(struct expressed_interest *interest,
00502                      struct ccn_charbuf *cb)
00503 {
00504     if (interest->magic != 0x7059e5f4) {
00505         ccn_gripe(interest);
00506         return;
00507     }
00508     if (interest->interest_msg != NULL)
00509         free(interest->interest_msg);
00510     interest->interest_msg = NULL;
00511     interest->size = 0;
00512     if (cb != NULL && cb->length > 0) {
00513         interest->interest_msg = calloc(1, cb->length);
00514         if (interest->interest_msg != NULL) {
00515             memcpy(interest->interest_msg, cb->buf, cb->length);
00516             interest->size = cb->length;
00517         }
00518     }
00519 }
00520 
00521 static struct expressed_interest *
00522 ccn_destroy_interest(struct ccn *h, struct expressed_interest *i)
00523 {
00524     struct expressed_interest *ans = i->next;
00525     if (i->magic != 0x7059e5f4) {
00526         ccn_gripe(i);
00527         return(NULL);
00528     }
00529     ccn_replace_handler(h, &(i->action), NULL);
00530     replace_interest_msg(i, NULL);
00531     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&i->wanted_pub);
00532     i->magic = -1;
00533     free(i);
00534     return(ans);
00535 }
00536 
00537 void
00538 ccn_check_interests(struct expressed_interest *list)
00539 {
00540     struct expressed_interest *ie;
00541     for (ie = list; ie != NULL; ie = ie->next) {
00542         if (ie->magic != 0x7059e5f4) {
00543             ccn_gripe(ie);
00544             abort();
00545         }
00546     }
00547 }
00548 
00549 void
00550 ccn_clean_interests_by_prefix(struct ccn *h, struct interests_by_prefix *entry)
00551 {
00552     struct expressed_interest *ie;
00553     struct expressed_interest *next;
00554     struct expressed_interest **ip;
00555     ccn_check_interests(entry->list);
00556     ip = &(entry->list);
00557     for (ie = entry->list; ie != NULL; ie = next) {
00558         next = ie->next;
00559         if (ie->action == NULL)
00560             ccn_destroy_interest(h, ie);
00561         else {
00562             (*ip) = ie;
00563             ip = &(ie->next);
00564         }
00565     }
00566     (*ip) = NULL;
00567     ccn_check_interests(entry->list);
00568 }
00569 
00570 void
00571 ccn_destroy(struct ccn **hp)
00572 {
00573     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
00574     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
00575     struct ccn *h = *hp;
00576     if (h == NULL)
00577         return;
00578     ccn_schedule_destroy(&h->schedule);
00579     ccn_disconnect(h);
00580     if (h->interests_by_prefix != NULL) {
00581         for (hashtb_start(h->interests_by_prefix, e); e->data != NULL; hashtb_next(e)) {
00582             struct interests_by_prefix *entry = e->data;
00583             while (entry->list != NULL)
00584                 entry->list = ccn_destroy_interest(h, entry->list);
00585         }
00586         hashtb_end(e);
00587         hashtb_destroy(&(h->interests_by_prefix));
00588     }
00589     if (h->interest_filters != NULL) {
00590         for (hashtb_start(h->interest_filters, e); e->data != NULL; hashtb_next(e)) {
00591             struct interest_filter *i = e->data;
00592             ccn_replace_handler(h, &(i->action), NULL);
00593         }
00594         hashtb_end(e);
00595         hashtb_destroy(&(h->interest_filters));
00596     }
00597     hashtb_destroy(&(h->keys));
00598     hashtb_destroy(&(h->keystores));
00599     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->interestbuf);
00600     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->inbuf);
00601     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->outbuf);
00602     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&h->scratch_indexbuf);
00603     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->default_pubid);
00604     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->ccndid);
00605     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&h->connect_type);
00606     if (h->tap != -1)
00607         close(h->tap);
00608     free(h);
00609     *hp = NULL;
00610 }
00611 
00612 /*
00613  * ccn_check_namebuf: check that name is valid
00614  * Returns the byte offset of the end of prefix portion,
00615  * as given by prefix_comps, or -1 for error.
00616  * prefix_comps = -1 means the whole name is the prefix.
00617  * If omit_possible_digest, chops off a potential digest name at the end
00618  */
00619 static int
00620 ccn_check_namebuf(struct ccn *h, struct ccn_charbuf *namebuf, int prefix_comps,
00621                   int omit_possible_digest)
00622 {
00623     struct ccn_buf_decoder decoder;
00624     struct ccn_buf_decoder *d;
00625     int i = 0;
00626     int ans = 0;
00627     int prev_ans = 0;
00628     if (namebuf == NULL || namebuf->length < 2)
00629         return(-1);
00630     d = ccn_buf_decoder_start(&decoder, namebuf->buf, namebuf->length);
00631     if (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Name)) {
00632         ccn_buf_advance(d);
00633         prev_ans = ans = d->decoder.token_index;
00634         while (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Component)) {
00635             ccn_buf_advance(d);
00636             if (ccn_buf_match_blob(d, NULL, NULL)) {
00637                 ccn_buf_advance(d);
00638             }
00639             ccn_buf_check_close(d);
00640             i += 1;
00641             if (prefix_comps < 0 || i <= prefix_comps) {
00642                 prev_ans = ans;
00643                 ans = d->decoder.token_index;
00644             }
00645         }
00646         ccn_buf_check_close(d);
00647     }
00648     if (d->decoder.state < 0 || ans < prefix_comps)
00649         return(-1);
00650     if (omit_possible_digest && ans == prev_ans + 36 && ans == namebuf->length - 1)
00651         return(prev_ans);
00652     return(ans);
00653 }
00654 
00655 static void
00656 ccn_construct_interest(struct ccn *h,
00657                        struct ccn_charbuf *name_prefix,
00658                        struct ccn_charbuf *interest_template,
00659                        struct expressed_interest *dest)
00660 {
00661     struct ccn_charbuf *c = h->interestbuf;
00662     size_t start;
00663     size_t size;
00664     int res;
00665 
00666     dest->lifetime_us = CCN_INTEREST_LIFETIME_MICROSEC;
00667     c->length = 0;
00668     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(c, CCN_DTAG_Interest, CCN_DTAG);
00669     ccn_charbuf_append(c, name_prefix->buf, name_prefix->length);
00670     res = 0;
00671     if (interest_template != NULL) {
00672         struct ccn_parsed_interest pi = { 0 };
00673         res = ccn_parse_interest(interest_template->buf,
00674                                  interest_template->length, &pi, NULL);
00675         if (res >= 0) {
00676             intmax_t lifetime = ccn_interest_lifetime(interest_template->buf, &pi);
00677             // XXX - for now, don't try to handle lifetimes over 30 seconds.
00678             if (lifetime < 1 || lifetime > (30 << 12))
00679                 NOTE_ERR(h, EINVAL);
00680             else
00681                 dest->lifetime_us = (lifetime * 1000000) >> 12;
00682             start = pi.offset[CCN_PI_E_Name];
00683             size = pi.offset[CCN_PI_B_Nonce] - start;
00684             ccn_charbuf_append(c, interest_template->buf + start, size);
00685             start = pi.offset[CCN_PI_B_OTHER];
00686             size = pi.offset[CCN_PI_E_OTHER] - start;
00687             if (size != 0)
00688                 ccn_charbuf_append(c, interest_template->buf + start, size);
00689         }
00690         else
00691             NOTE_ERR(h, EINVAL);
00692     }
00693     ccn_charbuf_append_closer(c);
00694     replace_interest_msg(dest, (res >= 0 ? c : NULL));
00695 }
00696 
00697 int
00698 ccn_express_interest(struct ccn *h,
00699                      struct ccn_charbuf *namebuf,
00700                      struct ccn_closure *action,
00701                      struct ccn_charbuf *interest_template)
00702 {
00703     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
00704     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
00705     int res;
00706     int prefixend;
00707     struct expressed_interest *interest = NULL;
00708     struct interests_by_prefix *entry = NULL;
00709     if (h->interests_by_prefix == NULL) {
00710         h->interests_by_prefix = hashtb_create(sizeof(struct interests_by_prefix), NULL);
00711         if (h->interests_by_prefix == NULL)
00712             return(NOTE_ERRNO(h));
00713     }
00714     prefixend = ccn_check_namebuf(h, namebuf, -1, 1);
00715     if (prefixend < 0)
00716         return(prefixend);
00717     /*
00718      * To make it easy to lookup prefixes of names, we keep only
00719      * the prefix name components as the key in the hash table.
00720      */
00721     hashtb_start(h->interests_by_prefix, e);
00722     res = hashtb_seek(e, namebuf->buf + 1, prefixend - 1, 0);
00723     entry = e->data;
00724     if (entry == NULL) {
00725         NOTE_ERRNO(h);
00726         hashtb_end(e);
00727         return(res);
00728     }
00729     if (res == HT_NEW_ENTRY)
00730         entry->list = NULL;
00731     interest = calloc(1, sizeof(*interest));
00732     if (interest == NULL) {
00733         NOTE_ERRNO(h);
00734         hashtb_end(e);
00735         return(-1);
00736     }
00737     interest->magic = 0x7059e5f4;
00738     ccn_construct_interest(h, namebuf, interest_template, interest);
00739     if (interest->interest_msg == NULL) {
00740         free(interest);
00741         hashtb_end(e);
00742         return(-1);
00743     }
00744     ccn_replace_handler(h, &(interest->action), action);
00745     interest->target = 1;
00746     interest->next = entry->list;
00747     entry->list = interest;
00748     hashtb_end(e);
00749     /* Actually send the interest out right away */
00750     ccn_refresh_interest(h, interest);
00751     return(0);
00752 }
00753 
00754 static void
00755 finalize_interest_filter(struct hashtb_enumerator *e)
00756 {
00757     struct interest_filter *i = e->data;
00758     if (i->ccn_reg_closure != NULL) {
00759         i->ccn_reg_closure->interest_filter = NULL;
00760         i->ccn_reg_closure = NULL;
00761     }
00762 }
00763 
00764 /**
00765  * Register to receive interests on a prefix, with forwarding flags
00766  *
00767  * See ccn_set_interest_filter for a description of the basic operation.
00768  *
00769  * The additional forw_flags argument offers finer control of which
00770  * interests are forward to the application.
00771  * Refer to doc/technical/Registration for details.
00772  *
00773  * There may be multiple actions associated with the prefix.  They will be
00774  * called in an unspecified order.  The flags passed to ccnd will be
00775  * the inclusive-or of the flags associated with each action.
00776  *
00777  * Passing a value of 0 for forw_flags will unregister just this specific action,
00778  * leaving other actions untouched.
00779  *
00780  * @returns -1 in case of error, non-negative for success.
00781  */
00782 int
00783 ccn_set_interest_filter_with_flags(struct ccn *h, struct ccn_charbuf *namebuf,
00784                         struct ccn_closure *action, int forw_flags)
00785 {
00786     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
00787     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
00788     int res;
00789     struct interest_filter *entry;
00790 
00791     if (h->interest_filters == NULL) {
00792         struct hashtb_param param = {0};
00793         param.finalize = &finalize_interest_filter;
00794         h->interest_filters = hashtb_create(sizeof(struct interest_filter), &param);
00795         if (h->interest_filters == NULL)
00796             return(NOTE_ERRNO(h));
00797     }
00798     res = ccn_check_namebuf(h, namebuf, -1, 0);
00799     if (res < 0)
00800         return(res);
00801     hashtb_start(h->interest_filters, e);
00802     res = hashtb_seek(e, namebuf->buf + 1, namebuf->length - 2, 0);
00803     if (res >= 0) {
00804         entry = e->data;
00805         if (entry->action != NULL && action != NULL && action != entry->action)
00806             res = update_multifilt(h, entry, action, forw_flags);
00807         else {
00808             update_ifilt_flags(h, entry, forw_flags);
00809             ccn_replace_handler(h, &(entry->action), action);
00810         }
00811         if (entry->action == NULL)
00812             hashtb_delete(e);
00813     }
00814     hashtb_end(e);
00815     return(res);
00816 }
00817 
00818 /**
00819  * Register to receive interests on a prefix
00820  *
00821  * The action will be called upon the arrival of an interest that
00822  * has the given name as a prefix.
00823  *
00824  * If action is NULL, any existing filter for the prefix is removed.
00825  * Note that this may have undesirable effects in applications that share
00826  * the same handle for independently operating subcomponents.
00827  * See ccn_set_interest_filter_with_flags() for a way to deal with this.
00828  *
00829  * The contents of namebuf are copied as needed.
00830  *
00831  * The handler should return CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_INTEREST_CONSUMED as a
00832  * promise that it has produced, or will soon produce, a matching content
00833  * object.
00834  *
00835  * The upcall kind passed to the handler will be CCN_UPCALL_INTEREST
00836  * if no other handler has claimed to produce content, or else
00837  * CCN_UPCALL_CONSUMED_INTEREST.
00838  *
00839  * This call is equivalent to a call to ccn_set_interest_filter_with_flags,
00840  * passing the forwarding flags (CCN_FORW_ACTIVE | CCN_FORW_CHILD_INHERIT).
00841  *
00842  * @returns -1 in case of error, non-negative for success.
00843  */
00844 int
00845 ccn_set_interest_filter(struct ccn *h, struct ccn_charbuf *namebuf,
00846                         struct ccn_closure *action)
00847 {
00848     int forw_flags = CCN_FORW_ACTIVE | CCN_FORW_CHILD_INHERIT;
00849     return(ccn_set_interest_filter_with_flags(h, namebuf, action, forw_flags));
00850 }
00851 
00852 /**
00853  * Change forwarding flags, triggering a refresh as needed.
00854  */
00855 static void
00856 update_ifilt_flags(struct ccn *h, struct interest_filter *f, int forw_flags)
00857 {
00858     if (f->flags != forw_flags) {
00859         memset(&f->expiry, 0, sizeof(f->expiry));
00860         f->flags = forw_flags;
00861     }
00862 }
00863 
00864 /* * * multifilt * * */
00865 
00866 /**
00867  * Item in the array of interest filters associated with one prefix
00868  */
00869 struct multifilt_item {
00870     struct ccn_closure *action;
00871     int forw_flags;
00872 };
00873 
00874 /**
00875  * Data for the multifilt case
00876  *
00877  * This wraps multiple interest filters up as a single one, so they
00878  * can share the single slot in a struct interest_filter.
00879  */
00880 struct multifilt {
00881     struct ccn_closure me;
00882     int n;                      /**< Number of elements in a */
00883     struct multifilt_item *a;   /**< The filters that are to be combined */
00884 };
00885 
00886 /* Prototypes */
00887 static enum ccn_upcall_res handle_multifilt(struct ccn_closure *selfp,
00888                                             enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
00889                                             struct ccn_upcall_info *info);
00890 static int build_multifilt_array(struct ccn *h,
00891                                  struct multifilt_item **ap,
00892                                  int n,
00893                                  struct ccn_closure *action,
00894                                  int forw_flags);
00895 static void destroy_multifilt_array(struct ccn *h,
00896                                     struct multifilt_item **ap,
00897                                     int n);
00898 
00899 /**
00900  * Take care of the case of multiple filters registered on one prefix
00901  *
00902  * Avoid calling when either action or f->action is NULL.
00903  */
00904 static int
00905 update_multifilt(struct ccn *h,
00906                  struct interest_filter *f,
00907                  struct ccn_closure *action,
00908                  int forw_flags)
00909 {
00910     struct multifilt *md = NULL;
00911     struct multifilt_item *a = NULL;
00912     int flags;
00913     int i;
00914     int n = 0;
00915 
00916     if (action->p == &handle_multifilt) {
00917         /* This should never happen. */
00918         abort();
00919     }
00920     if (f->action->p == &handle_multifilt) {
00921         /* Already have a multifilt */
00922         md = f->action->data;
00923         if (md->me.data != md)
00924             abort();
00925         a = md->a;
00926     }
00927     else {
00928         /* Make a new multifilt, with 2 slots */
00929         a = calloc(2, sizeof(*a));
00930         if (a == NULL)
00931             return(NOTE_ERRNO(h));
00932         md = calloc(1, sizeof(*md));
00933         if (md == NULL) {
00934             free(a);
00935             return(NOTE_ERRNO(h));
00936         }
00937         md->me.p = &handle_multifilt;
00938         md->me.data = md;
00939         md->n = 2;
00940         md->a = a;
00941         ccn_replace_handler(h, &(a[0].action), f->action);
00942         a[0].forw_flags = f->flags;
00943         ccn_replace_handler(h, &(a[1].action), action);
00944         a[1].forw_flags = 0; /* Actually set these below */
00945         ccn_replace_handler(h, &f->action, &md->me);
00946     }
00947     /* Search for the action */
00948     for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00949         if (a[i].action == action) {
00950             a[i].forw_flags = forw_flags;
00951             if (forw_flags == 0) {
00952                 ccn_replace_handler(h, &(a[i].action), NULL);
00953                 action = NULL;
00954             }
00955             goto Finish;
00956         }
00957     }
00958     /* Not there, but if the flags are 0 we do not need to remember action */
00959     if (forw_flags == 0) {
00960         action->refcount++;
00961         ccn_replace_handler(h, &action, NULL);
00962         goto Finish;
00963     }
00964     /* Need to build a new array */
00965     n = build_multifilt_array(h, &a, n, action, forw_flags);
00966     if (n < 0)
00967         return(n);
00968     destroy_multifilt_array(h, &md->a, md->n);
00969     md->a = a;
00970     md->n = n;
00971 Finish:
00972     /* The only thing left to do is to combine the forwarding flags */
00973     for (i = 0, flags = 0; i < n; i++)
00974         flags |= a[i].forw_flags;
00975     update_ifilt_flags(h, f, flags);
00976     return(0);
00977 }
00978 
00979 /**
00980  * Replace *ap with a copy, perhaps with one additional element
00981  *
00982  * The old array is not modified.  Empty slots are not copied.
00983  *
00984  * @returns new count, or -1 in case of an error.
00985  */
00986 static int
00987 build_multifilt_array(struct ccn *h,
00988                       struct multifilt_item **ap,
00989                       int n,
00990                       struct ccn_closure *action,
00991                       int forw_flags)
00992 {
00993     struct multifilt_item *a = NULL; /* old array */
00994     struct multifilt_item *c = NULL; /* new array */
00995     int i, j, m;
00996 
00997     a = *ap;
00998     /* Determine how many slots we will need */
00999     for (m = 0, i = 0; i < n; i++) {
01000         if (a[i].action != NULL)
01001             m++;
01002     }
01003     if (action != NULL)
01004         m++;
01005     if (m == 0) {
01006         *ap = NULL;
01007         return(0);
01008     }
01009     c = calloc(m, sizeof(*c));
01010     if (c == NULL)
01011         return(NOTE_ERRNO(h));
01012     for (i = 0, j = 0; i < n; i++) {
01013         if (a[i].action != NULL) {
01014             ccn_replace_handler(h, &(c[j].action), a[i].action);
01015             c[j].forw_flags = a[i].forw_flags;
01016             j++;
01017         }
01018     }
01019     if (j < m) {
01020         ccn_replace_handler(h, &(c[j].action), action);
01021         c[j].forw_flags = forw_flags;
01022     }
01023     *ap = c;
01024     return(m);
01025 }
01026 
01027 /**
01028  * Destroy a multifilt_array
01029  */
01030 static void
01031 destroy_multifilt_array(struct ccn *h, struct multifilt_item **ap, int n)
01032 {
01033     struct multifilt_item *a;
01034     int i;
01035 
01036     a = *ap;
01037     if (a != NULL) {
01038         for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
01039             ccn_replace_handler(h, &(a[i].action), NULL);
01040         free(a);
01041         *ap = NULL;
01042     }
01043 }
01044 
01045 /**
01046  * Upcall to handle multifilt
01047  */
01048 static enum ccn_upcall_res
01049 handle_multifilt(struct ccn_closure *selfp,
01050                  enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
01051                  struct ccn_upcall_info *info)
01052 {
01053     struct multifilt *md;
01054     struct multifilt_item *a;
01055     enum ccn_upcall_res ans;
01056     enum ccn_upcall_res res;
01057     int i, n;
01058 
01059     md = selfp->data;
01060     if (kind == CCN_UPCALL_FINAL) {
01061         destroy_multifilt_array(info->h, &md->a, md->n);
01062         free(md);
01063         return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
01064     }
01065     /*
01066      * Since the upcalls might be changing registrations on the fly,
01067      * we need to make a copy of the array (updating the refcounts).
01068      * Forget md and selfp, since they could go away during upcalls.
01069      */
01070     a = md->a;
01071     n = build_multifilt_array(info->h, &a, md->n, NULL, 0);
01072     ans = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK;
01073     md = NULL;
01074     selfp = NULL;
01075     for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
01076         if ((a[i].forw_flags & CCN_FORW_ACTIVE) != 0) {
01077             res = (a[i].action->p)(a[i].action, kind, info);
01078             if (res == CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_INTEREST_CONSUMED) {
01079                 ans = res;
01080                 if (kind == CCN_UPCALL_INTEREST)
01081                     kind = CCN_UPCALL_CONSUMED_INTEREST;
01082             }
01083         }
01084     }
01085     destroy_multifilt_array(info->h, &a, n);
01086     return(ans);
01087 }
01088 
01089 /* end of multifilt */
01090 
01091 static int
01092 ccn_pushout(struct ccn *h)
01093 {
01094     ssize_t res;
01095     size_t size;
01096     if (h->outbuf != NULL && h->outbufindex < h->outbuf->length) {
01097         if (h->sock < 0)
01098             return(1);
01099         size = h->outbuf->length - h->outbufindex;
01100         res = write(h->sock, h->outbuf->buf + h->outbufindex, size);
01101         if (res == size) {
01102             h->outbuf->length = h->outbufindex = 0;
01103             return(0);
01104         }
01105         if (res == -1)
01106             return ((errno == EAGAIN) ? 1 : NOTE_ERRNO(h));
01107         h->outbufindex += res;
01108         return(1);
01109     }
01110     return(0);
01111 }
01112 
01113 int
01114 ccn_put(struct ccn *h, const void *p, size_t length)
01115 {
01116     struct ccn_skeleton_decoder dd = {0};
01117     ssize_t res;
01118     if (h == NULL)
01119         return(-1);
01120     if (p == NULL || length == 0)
01121         return(NOTE_ERR(h, EINVAL));
01122     res = ccn_skeleton_decode(&dd, p, length);
01123     if (!(res == length && dd.state == 0))
01124         return(NOTE_ERR(h, EINVAL));
01125     if (h->tap != -1) {
01126         res = write(h->tap, p, length);
01127         if (res == -1) {
01128             NOTE_ERRNO(h);
01129             (void)close(h->tap);
01130             h->tap = -1;
01131         }
01132     }
01133     if (h->outbuf != NULL && h->outbufindex < h->outbuf->length) {
01134         // XXX - should limit unbounded growth of h->outbuf
01135         ccn_charbuf_append(h->outbuf, p, length); // XXX - check res
01136         return (ccn_pushout(h));
01137     }
01138     if (h->sock == -1)
01139         res = 0;
01140     else
01141         res = write(h->sock, p, length);
01142     if (res == length)
01143         return(0);
01144     if (res == -1) {
01145         if (errno != EAGAIN)
01146             return(NOTE_ERRNO(h));
01147         res = 0;
01148     }
01149     if (h->outbuf == NULL) {
01150         h->outbuf = ccn_charbuf_create();
01151         h->outbufindex = 0;
01152     }
01153     ccn_charbuf_append(h->outbuf, ((const unsigned char *)p)+res, length-res);
01154     return(1);
01155 }
01156 
01157 int
01158 ccn_output_is_pending(struct ccn *h)
01159 {
01160     return(h != NULL && h->outbuf != NULL && h->outbufindex < h->outbuf->length);
01161 }
01162 
01163 struct ccn_charbuf *
01164 ccn_grab_buffered_output(struct ccn *h)
01165 {
01166     if (ccn_output_is_pending(h) && h->outbufindex == 0) {
01167         struct ccn_charbuf *ans = h->outbuf;
01168         h->outbuf = NULL;
01169         return(ans);
01170     }
01171     return(NULL);
01172 }
01173 
01174 static void
01175 ccn_refresh_interest(struct ccn *h, struct expressed_interest *interest)
01176 {
01177     int res;
01178     if (interest->magic != 0x7059e5f4) {
01179         ccn_gripe(interest);
01180         return;
01181     }
01182     if (interest->outstanding < interest->target) {
01183         res = ccn_put(h, interest->interest_msg, interest->size);
01184         if (res >= 0) {
01185             interest->outstanding += 1;
01186             if (h->now.tv_sec == 0)
01187                 gettimeofday(&h->now, NULL);
01188             interest->lasttime = h->now;
01189         }
01190     }
01191 }
01192 
01193 static int
01194 ccn_get_content_type(const unsigned char *ccnb,
01195                      const struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pco)
01196 {
01197     enum ccn_content_type type = pco->type;
01198     (void)ccnb; // XXX - don't need now
01199     switch (type) {
01200         case CCN_CONTENT_DATA:
01201         case CCN_CONTENT_ENCR:
01202         case CCN_CONTENT_GONE:
01203         case CCN_CONTENT_KEY:
01204         case CCN_CONTENT_LINK:
01205         case CCN_CONTENT_NACK:
01206             return (type);
01207         default:
01208             return (-1);
01209     }
01210 }
01211 
01212 /**
01213  * Compute the digest of just the Content portion of content_object.
01214  */
01215 static void
01216 ccn_digest_Content(const unsigned char *content_object,
01217                    struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pc,
01218                    unsigned char *digest,
01219                    size_t digest_bytes)
01220 {
01221     int res;
01222     struct ccn_digest *d = NULL;
01223     const unsigned char *content = NULL;
01224     size_t content_bytes = 0;
01225 
01226     if (pc->magic < 20080000) abort();
01227     if (digest_bytes == sizeof(digest))
01228         return;
01229     d = ccn_digest_create(CCN_DIGEST_SHA256);
01230     ccn_digest_init(d);
01231     res = ccn_ref_tagged_BLOB(CCN_DTAG_Content, content_object,
01232                               pc->offset[CCN_PCO_B_Content],
01233                               pc->offset[CCN_PCO_E_Content],
01234                               &content, &content_bytes);
01235     if (res < 0) abort();
01236     res = ccn_digest_update(d, content, content_bytes);
01237     if (res < 0) abort();
01238     res = ccn_digest_final(d, digest, digest_bytes);
01239     if (res < 0) abort();
01240     ccn_digest_destroy(&d);
01241 }
01242 
01243 static int
01244 ccn_cache_key(struct ccn *h,
01245               const unsigned char *ccnb, size_t size,
01246               struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pco)
01247 {
01248     int type;
01249     struct ccn_pkey **entry;
01250     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01251     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01252     int res;
01253     unsigned char digest[32];
01254 
01255     type = ccn_get_content_type(ccnb, pco);
01256     if (type != CCN_CONTENT_KEY) {
01257         return (0);
01258     }
01259 
01260     ccn_digest_Content(ccnb, pco, digest, sizeof(digest));
01261 
01262     hashtb_start(h->keys, e);
01263     res = hashtb_seek(e, (void *)digest, sizeof(digest), 0);
01264     if (res < 0) {
01265         hashtb_end(e);
01266         return(NOTE_ERRNO(h));
01267     }
01268     entry = e->data;
01269     if (res == HT_NEW_ENTRY) {
01270         struct ccn_pkey *pkey;
01271         const unsigned char *data = NULL;
01272         size_t data_size = 0;
01273 
01274         res = ccn_content_get_value(ccnb, size, pco, &data, &data_size);
01275         if (res < 0) {
01276             hashtb_delete(e);
01277             hashtb_end(e);
01278             return(NOTE_ERRNO(h));
01279         }
01280         pkey = ccn_d2i_pubkey(data, data_size);
01281         if (pkey == NULL) {
01282             hashtb_delete(e);
01283             hashtb_end(e);
01284             return(NOTE_ERRNO(h));
01285         }
01286         *entry = pkey;
01287     }
01288     hashtb_end(e);
01289     return (0);
01290 }
01291 
01292 static void
01293 finalize_pkey(struct hashtb_enumerator *e)
01294 {
01295     struct ccn_pkey **entry = e->data;
01296     if (*entry != NULL)
01297         ccn_pubkey_free(*entry);
01298 }
01299 
01300 /**
01301  * Examine a ContentObject and try to find the public key needed to
01302  * verify it.  It might be present in our cache of keys, or in the
01303  * object itself; in either of these cases, we can satisfy the request
01304  * right away. Or there may be an indirection (a KeyName), in which case
01305  * return without the key. The final possibility is that there is no key
01306  * locator we can make sense of.
01307  * @returns negative for error, 0 when pubkey is filled in,
01308  *         or 1 if the key needs to be requested.
01309  */
01310 static int
01311 ccn_locate_key(struct ccn *h,
01312                const unsigned char *msg,
01313                struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pco,
01314                struct ccn_pkey **pubkey)
01315 {
01316     int res;
01317     const unsigned char *pkeyid;
01318     size_t pkeyid_size;
01319     struct ccn_pkey **entry;
01320     struct ccn_buf_decoder decoder;
01321     struct ccn_buf_decoder *d;
01322 
01323     if (h->keys == NULL) {
01324         return (NOTE_ERR(h, EINVAL));
01325     }
01326 
01327     res = ccn_ref_tagged_BLOB(CCN_DTAG_PublisherPublicKeyDigest, msg,
01328                               pco->offset[CCN_PCO_B_PublisherPublicKeyDigest],
01329                               pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E_PublisherPublicKeyDigest],
01330                               &pkeyid, &pkeyid_size);
01331     if (res < 0)
01332         return (NOTE_ERR(h, res));
01333     entry = hashtb_lookup(h->keys, pkeyid, pkeyid_size);
01334     if (entry != NULL) {
01335         *pubkey = *entry;
01336         return (0);
01337     }
01338     /* Is a key locator present? */
01339     if (pco->offset[CCN_PCO_B_KeyLocator] == pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E_KeyLocator])
01340         return (-1);
01341     /* Use the key locator */
01342     d = ccn_buf_decoder_start(&decoder, msg + pco->offset[CCN_PCO_B_Key_Certificate_KeyName],
01343                               pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E_Key_Certificate_KeyName] -
01344                               pco->offset[CCN_PCO_B_Key_Certificate_KeyName]);
01345     if (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_KeyName)) {
01346         return(1);
01347     }
01348     else if (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Key)) {
01349         const unsigned char *dkey;
01350         size_t dkey_size;
01351         struct ccn_digest *digest = NULL;
01352         unsigned char *key_digest = NULL;
01353         size_t key_digest_size;
01354         struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01355         struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01356 
01357         res = ccn_ref_tagged_BLOB(CCN_DTAG_Key, msg,
01358                                   pco->offset[CCN_PCO_B_Key_Certificate_KeyName],
01359                                   pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E_Key_Certificate_KeyName],
01360                                   &dkey, &dkey_size);
01361         *pubkey = ccn_d2i_pubkey(dkey, dkey_size);
01362         digest = ccn_digest_create(CCN_DIGEST_SHA256);
01363         ccn_digest_init(digest);
01364         key_digest_size = ccn_digest_size(digest);
01365         key_digest = calloc(1, key_digest_size);
01366         if (key_digest == NULL) abort();
01367         res = ccn_digest_update(digest, dkey, dkey_size);
01368         if (res < 0) abort();
01369         res = ccn_digest_final(digest, key_digest, key_digest_size);
01370         if (res < 0) abort();
01371         ccn_digest_destroy(&digest);
01372         hashtb_start(h->keys, e);
01373         res = hashtb_seek(e, (void *)key_digest, key_digest_size, 0);
01374         free(key_digest);
01375         key_digest = NULL;
01376         if (res < 0) {
01377             hashtb_end(e);
01378             return(NOTE_ERRNO(h));
01379         }
01380         entry = e->data;
01381         if (res == HT_NEW_ENTRY) {
01382             *entry = *pubkey;
01383         }
01384         else
01385             THIS_CANNOT_HAPPEN(h);
01386         hashtb_end(e);
01387         return (0);
01388     }
01389     else if (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Certificate)) {
01390         XXX; // what should we really do in this case?
01391     }
01392 
01393     return (-1);
01394 }
01395 
01396 /**
01397  * Get the name out of a Link.
01398  *
01399  * XXX - this needs a better home.
01400  */
01401 static int
01402 ccn_append_link_name(struct ccn_charbuf *name, const unsigned char *data, size_t data_size)
01403 {
01404     struct ccn_buf_decoder decoder;
01405     struct ccn_buf_decoder *d;
01406     size_t start = 0;
01407     size_t end = 0;
01408 
01409     d = ccn_buf_decoder_start(&decoder, data, data_size);
01410     if (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Link)) {
01411         ccn_buf_advance(d);
01412         start = d->decoder.token_index;
01413         ccn_parse_Name(d, NULL);
01414         end = d->decoder.token_index;
01415         ccn_buf_check_close(d);
01416         if (d->decoder.state < 0)
01417             return (d->decoder.state);
01418         ccn_charbuf_append(name, data + start, end - start);
01419         return(0);
01420         }
01421     return(-1);
01422 }
01423 
01424 /**
01425  * Called when we get an answer to a KeyLocator fetch issued by
01426  * ccn_initiate_key_fetch.  This does not really have to do much,
01427  * since the main content handling logic picks up the keys as they
01428  * go by.
01429  */
01430 static enum ccn_upcall_res
01431 handle_key(struct ccn_closure *selfp,
01432            enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
01433            struct ccn_upcall_info *info)
01434 {
01435     struct ccn *h = info->h;
01436     (void)h;
01437     int type = 0;
01438     const unsigned char *msg = NULL;
01439     const unsigned char *data = NULL;
01440     size_t size;
01441     size_t data_size;
01442     int res;
01443     struct ccn_charbuf *name = NULL;
01444     struct ccn_charbuf *templ = NULL;
01445 
01446     switch(kind) {
01447         case CCN_UPCALL_FINAL:
01448             free(selfp);
01449             return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
01450         case CCN_UPCALL_INTEREST_TIMED_OUT:
01451             /* Don't keep trying */
01452             return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
01453         case CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_UNVERIFIED:
01454             /* This is not exactly right, but trying to follow the KeyLocator could be worse trouble. */
01455         case CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_KEYMISSING:
01456         case CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_RAW:
01457         case CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT:
01458             type = ccn_get_content_type(msg, info->pco);
01459             if (type == CCN_CONTENT_KEY)
01460                 return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
01461             if (type == CCN_CONTENT_LINK) {
01462                 /* resolve the link */
01463                 /* Limit how much we work at this. */
01464                 if (selfp->intdata <= 0)
01465                     return(NOTE_ERR(h, ELOOP));
01466                 selfp->intdata -= 1;
01467                 msg = info->content_ccnb;
01468                 size = info->pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E];
01469                 res = ccn_content_get_value(info->content_ccnb, size, info->pco,
01470                                             &data, &data_size);
01471                 if (res < 0)
01472                     return (CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR);
01473                 templ = ccn_charbuf_create();
01474                 ccn_charbuf_append_tt(templ, CCN_DTAG_Interest, CCN_DTAG);
01475                 ccn_charbuf_append_tt(templ, CCN_DTAG_Name, CCN_DTAG);
01476                 ccn_charbuf_append_closer(templ); /* </Name> */
01477                 ccnb_tagged_putf(templ, CCN_DTAG_MinSuffixComponents, "%d", 1);
01478                 ccnb_tagged_putf(templ, CCN_DTAG_MaxSuffixComponents, "%d", 3);
01479                 ccn_charbuf_append_closer(templ); /* </Interest> */
01480                 name = ccn_charbuf_create();
01481                 res = ccn_append_link_name(name, data, data_size);
01482                 if (res < 0) {
01483                     NOTE_ERR(h, EINVAL);
01484                     res = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR;
01485                 }
01486                 else
01487                     res = ccn_express_interest(h, name, selfp, templ);
01488                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
01489                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&templ);
01490                 return(res);
01491             }
01492             return (CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR);
01493         default:
01494             return (CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR);
01495     }
01496 }
01497 
01498 /**
01499  * This is the maximum number of links in we are willing to traverse
01500  * when resolving a key locator.
01501  */
01502 #ifndef CCN_MAX_KEY_LINK_CHAIN
01503 #define CCN_MAX_KEY_LINK_CHAIN 7
01504 #endif
01505 
01506 static int
01507 ccn_initiate_key_fetch(struct ccn *h,
01508                        unsigned char *msg,
01509                        struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pco,
01510                        struct expressed_interest *trigger_interest)
01511 {
01512     /* 
01513      * Create a new interest in the key name, set up a callback that will
01514      * insert the key into the h->keys hashtb for the calling handle and
01515      * cause the trigger_interest to be re-expressed.
01516      */
01517     int res;
01518     int namelen;
01519     struct ccn_charbuf *key_name = NULL;
01520     struct ccn_closure *key_closure = NULL;
01521     const unsigned char *pkeyid = NULL;
01522     size_t pkeyid_size = 0;
01523     struct ccn_charbuf *templ = NULL;
01524 
01525     if (trigger_interest != NULL) {
01526         /* Arrange a wakeup when the key arrives */
01527         if (trigger_interest->wanted_pub == NULL)
01528             trigger_interest->wanted_pub = ccn_charbuf_create();
01529         res = ccn_ref_tagged_BLOB(CCN_DTAG_PublisherPublicKeyDigest, msg,
01530                                   pco->offset[CCN_PCO_B_PublisherPublicKeyDigest],
01531                                   pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E_PublisherPublicKeyDigest],
01532                                   &pkeyid, &pkeyid_size);
01533         if (trigger_interest->wanted_pub != NULL && res >= 0) {
01534             trigger_interest->wanted_pub->length = 0;
01535             ccn_charbuf_append(trigger_interest->wanted_pub, pkeyid, pkeyid_size);
01536         }
01537         trigger_interest->target = 0;
01538     }
01539 
01540     namelen = (pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E_KeyName_Name] -
01541                pco->offset[CCN_PCO_B_KeyName_Name]);
01542     /*
01543      * If there is no KeyName provided, we can't ask, but we might win if the
01544      * key arrives along with some other content.
01545      */
01546     if (namelen == 0)
01547         return(-1);
01548     key_closure = calloc(1, sizeof(*key_closure));
01549     if (key_closure == NULL)
01550         return (NOTE_ERRNO(h));
01551     key_closure->p = &handle_key;
01552     key_closure->intdata = CCN_MAX_KEY_LINK_CHAIN; /* to limit how many links we will resolve */
01553 
01554     key_name = ccn_charbuf_create();
01555     res = ccn_charbuf_append(key_name,
01556                              msg + pco->offset[CCN_PCO_B_KeyName_Name],
01557                              namelen);
01558     templ = ccn_charbuf_create();
01559     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(templ, CCN_DTAG_Interest, CCN_DTAG);
01560     ccn_charbuf_append_tt(templ, CCN_DTAG_Name, CCN_DTAG);
01561     ccn_charbuf_append_closer(templ); /* </Name> */
01562     ccnb_tagged_putf(templ, CCN_DTAG_MinSuffixComponents, "%d", 1);
01563     ccnb_tagged_putf(templ, CCN_DTAG_MaxSuffixComponents, "%d", 3);
01564     if (pco->offset[CCN_PCO_B_KeyName_Pub] < pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E_KeyName_Pub]) {
01565         ccn_charbuf_append(templ,
01566                            msg + pco->offset[CCN_PCO_B_KeyName_Pub],
01567                            (pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E_KeyName_Pub] - 
01568                             pco->offset[CCN_PCO_B_KeyName_Pub]));
01569     }
01570     ccn_charbuf_append_closer(templ); /* </Interest> */
01571     res = ccn_express_interest(h, key_name, key_closure, templ);
01572     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&key_name);
01573     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&templ);
01574     return(res);
01575 }
01576 
01577 /**
01578  * If we were waiting for a key and it has arrived,
01579  * refresh the interest.
01580  */
01581 static void
01582 ccn_check_pub_arrival(struct ccn *h, struct expressed_interest *interest)
01583 {
01584     struct ccn_charbuf *want = interest->wanted_pub;
01585     if (want == NULL)
01586         return;
01587     if (hashtb_lookup(h->keys, want->buf, want->length) != NULL) {
01588         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&interest->wanted_pub);
01589         interest->target = 1;
01590         ccn_refresh_interest(h, interest);
01591     }
01592 }
01593 
01594 /**
01595  * Dispatch a message through the registered upcalls.
01596  * This is not used by normal ccn clients, but is made available for use when
01597  * ccnd needs to communicate with its internal client.
01598  * @param h is the ccn handle.
01599  * @param msg is the ccnb-encoded Interest or ContentObject.
01600  * @param size is its size in bytes.
01601  */
01602 void
01603 ccn_dispatch_message(struct ccn *h, unsigned char *msg, size_t size)
01604 {
01605     struct ccn_parsed_interest pi = {0};
01606     struct ccn_upcall_info info = {0};
01607     int i;
01608     int res;
01609     enum ccn_upcall_res ures;
01610 
01611     h->running++;
01612     info.h = h;
01613     info.pi = &pi;
01614     info.interest_comps = ccn_indexbuf_obtain(h);
01615     res = ccn_parse_interest(msg, size, &pi, info.interest_comps);
01616     if (res >= 0) {
01617         /* This message is an Interest */
01618         enum ccn_upcall_kind upcall_kind = CCN_UPCALL_INTEREST;
01619         info.interest_ccnb = msg;
01620         if (h->interest_filters != NULL && info.interest_comps->n > 0) {
01621             struct ccn_indexbuf *comps = info.interest_comps;
01622             size_t keystart = comps->buf[0];
01623             unsigned char *key = msg + keystart;
01624             struct interest_filter *entry;
01625             for (i = comps->n - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
01626                 entry = hashtb_lookup(h->interest_filters, key, comps->buf[i] - keystart);
01627                 if (entry != NULL) {
01628                     info.matched_comps = i;
01629                     ures = (entry->action->p)(entry->action, upcall_kind, &info);
01630                     if (ures == CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_INTEREST_CONSUMED)
01631                         upcall_kind = CCN_UPCALL_CONSUMED_INTEREST;
01632                 }
01633             }
01634         }
01635     }
01636     else {
01637         /* This message should be a ContentObject. */
01638         struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject obj = {0};
01639         info.pco = &obj;
01640         info.content_comps = ccn_indexbuf_create();
01641         res = ccn_parse_ContentObject(msg, size, &obj, info.content_comps);
01642         if (res >= 0) {
01643             info.content_ccnb = msg;
01644             if (h->interests_by_prefix != NULL) {
01645                 struct ccn_indexbuf *comps = info.content_comps;
01646                 size_t keystart = comps->buf[0];
01647                 unsigned char *key = msg + keystart;
01648                 struct expressed_interest *interest = NULL;
01649                 struct interests_by_prefix *entry = NULL;
01650                 for (i = comps->n - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
01651                     entry = hashtb_lookup(h->interests_by_prefix, key, comps->buf[i] - keystart);
01652                     if (entry != NULL) {
01653                         for (interest = entry->list; interest != NULL; interest = interest->next) {
01654                             if (interest->magic != 0x7059e5f4) {
01655                                 ccn_gripe(interest);
01656                             }
01657                             if (interest->target > 0 && interest->outstanding > 0) {
01658                                 res = ccn_parse_interest(interest->interest_msg,
01659                                                          interest->size,
01660                                                          info.pi,
01661                                                          info.interest_comps);
01662                                 if (res >= 0 &&
01663                                     ccn_content_matches_interest(msg, size,
01664                                                                  1, info.pco,
01665                                                                  interest->interest_msg,
01666                                                                  interest->size,
01667                                                                  info.pi)) {
01668                                     enum ccn_upcall_kind upcall_kind = CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT;
01669                                     struct ccn_pkey *pubkey = NULL;
01670                                     int type = ccn_get_content_type(msg, info.pco);
01671                                     if (type == CCN_CONTENT_KEY)
01672                                         res = ccn_cache_key(h, msg, size, info.pco);
01673                                     res = ccn_locate_key(h, msg, info.pco, &pubkey);
01674                                     if (h->defer_verification) {
01675                                         if (res == 0)
01676                                             upcall_kind = CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_RAW;
01677                                         else
01678                                             upcall_kind = CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_KEYMISSING;
01679                                     }
01680                                     else if (res == 0) {
01681                                         /* we have the pubkey, use it to verify the msg */
01682                                         res = ccn_verify_signature(msg, size, info.pco, pubkey);
01683                                         upcall_kind = (res == 1) ? CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT : CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_BAD;
01684                                     } else
01685                                         upcall_kind = CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_UNVERIFIED;
01686                                     interest->outstanding -= 1;
01687                                     info.interest_ccnb = interest->interest_msg;
01688                                     info.matched_comps = i;
01689                                     ures = (interest->action->p)(interest->action,
01690                                                                  upcall_kind,
01691                                                                  &info);
01692                                     if (interest->magic != 0x7059e5f4)
01693                                         ccn_gripe(interest);
01694                                     if (ures == CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_REEXPRESS)
01695                                         ccn_refresh_interest(h, interest);
01696                                     else if ((ures == CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_VERIFY ||
01697                                               ures == CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_FETCHKEY) &&
01698                                              (upcall_kind == CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_UNVERIFIED ||
01699                                               upcall_kind == CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_KEYMISSING)) { /* KEYS */
01700                                         ccn_initiate_key_fetch(h, msg, info.pco, interest);
01701                                     }
01702                                     else if (ures == CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_VERIFY &&
01703                                              upcall_kind == CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_RAW) {
01704                                         /* For now, call this a client bug. */
01705                                         abort();
01706                                     }
01707                                     else {
01708                                         interest->target = 0;
01709                                         replace_interest_msg(interest, NULL);
01710                                         ccn_replace_handler(h, &(interest->action), NULL);
01711                                     }
01712                                 }
01713                             }
01714                         }
01715                     }
01716                 }
01717             }
01718         }
01719     } // XXX whew, what a lot of right braces!
01720     ccn_indexbuf_release(h, info.interest_comps);
01721     ccn_indexbuf_destroy(&info.content_comps);
01722     h->running--;
01723 }
01724 
01725 static int
01726 ccn_process_input(struct ccn *h)
01727 {
01728     ssize_t res;
01729     ssize_t msgstart;
01730     unsigned char *buf;
01731     struct ccn_skeleton_decoder *d = &h->decoder;
01732     struct ccn_charbuf *inbuf = h->inbuf;
01733     if (inbuf == NULL)
01734         h->inbuf = inbuf = ccn_charbuf_create();
01735     if (inbuf->length == 0)
01736         memset(d, 0, sizeof(*d));
01737     buf = ccn_charbuf_reserve(inbuf, 8800);
01738     res = read(h->sock, buf, inbuf->limit - inbuf->length);
01739     if (res == 0) {
01740         ccn_disconnect(h);
01741         return(-1);
01742     }
01743     if (res == -1) {
01744         if (errno == EAGAIN)
01745             res = 0;
01746         else
01747             return(NOTE_ERRNO(h));
01748     }
01749     inbuf->length += res;
01750     msgstart = 0;
01751     ccn_skeleton_decode(d, buf, res);
01752     while (d->state == 0) {
01753         ccn_dispatch_message(h, inbuf->buf + msgstart, 
01754                               d->index - msgstart);
01755         msgstart = d->index;
01756         if (msgstart == inbuf->length) {
01757             inbuf->length = 0;
01758             return(0);
01759         }
01760         ccn_skeleton_decode(d, inbuf->buf + d->index,
01761                             inbuf->length - d->index);
01762     }
01763     if (msgstart < inbuf->length && msgstart > 0) {
01764         /* move partial message to start of buffer */
01765         memmove(inbuf->buf, inbuf->buf + msgstart,
01766                 inbuf->length - msgstart);
01767         inbuf->length -= msgstart;
01768         d->index -= msgstart;
01769     }
01770     return(0);
01771 }
01772 
01773 static void
01774 ccn_update_refresh_us(struct ccn *h, struct timeval *tv)
01775 {
01776     int delta;
01777     if (tv->tv_sec < h->now.tv_sec)
01778         return;
01779     if (tv->tv_sec > h->now.tv_sec + CCN_INTEREST_LIFETIME_SEC)
01780         return;
01781     delta = (tv->tv_sec  - h->now.tv_sec)*1000000 +
01782             (tv->tv_usec - h->now.tv_usec);
01783     if (delta < 0)
01784         delta = 0;
01785     if (delta < h->refresh_us)
01786         h->refresh_us = delta;
01787 }
01788 
01789 static void
01790 ccn_age_interest(struct ccn *h,
01791                  struct expressed_interest *interest,
01792                  const unsigned char *key, size_t keysize)
01793 {
01794     struct ccn_parsed_interest pi = {0};
01795     struct ccn_upcall_info info = {0};
01796     int delta;
01797     int res;
01798     enum ccn_upcall_res ures;
01799     int firstcall;
01800     if (interest->magic != 0x7059e5f4)
01801         ccn_gripe(interest);
01802     info.h = h;
01803     info.pi = &pi;
01804     firstcall = (interest->lasttime.tv_sec == 0);
01805     if (interest->lasttime.tv_sec + 30 < h->now.tv_sec) {
01806         /* fixup so that delta does not overflow */
01807         interest->outstanding = 0;
01808         interest->lasttime = h->now;
01809         interest->lasttime.tv_sec -= 30;
01810     }
01811     delta = (h->now.tv_sec  - interest->lasttime.tv_sec)*1000000 +
01812             (h->now.tv_usec - interest->lasttime.tv_usec);
01813     if (delta >= interest->lifetime_us) {
01814         interest->outstanding = 0;
01815         delta = 0;
01816     }
01817     else if (delta < 0)
01818         delta = 0;
01819     if (interest->lifetime_us - delta < h->refresh_us)
01820         h->refresh_us = interest->lifetime_us - delta;
01821     interest->lasttime = h->now;
01822     while (delta > interest->lasttime.tv_usec) {
01823         delta -= 1000000;
01824         interest->lasttime.tv_sec -= 1;
01825     }
01826     interest->lasttime.tv_usec -= delta;
01827     if (interest->target > 0 && interest->outstanding == 0) {
01828         ures = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_REEXPRESS;
01829         if (!firstcall) {
01830             info.interest_ccnb = interest->interest_msg;
01831             info.interest_comps = ccn_indexbuf_obtain(h);
01832             res = ccn_parse_interest(interest->interest_msg,
01833                                      interest->size,
01834                                      info.pi,
01835                                      info.interest_comps);
01836             if (res >= 0) {
01837                 ures = (interest->action->p)(interest->action,
01838                                              CCN_UPCALL_INTEREST_TIMED_OUT,
01839                                              &info);
01840                 if (interest->magic != 0x7059e5f4)
01841                     ccn_gripe(interest);
01842             }
01843             else {
01844                 int i;
01845                 fprintf(stderr, "URP!! interest has been corrupted ccn_client.c:%d\n", __LINE__);
01846                 for (i = 0; i < 120; i++)
01847                     sleep(1);
01848                 ures = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR;
01849             }
01850             ccn_indexbuf_release(h, info.interest_comps);
01851         }
01852         if (ures == CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_REEXPRESS)
01853             ccn_refresh_interest(h, interest);
01854         else
01855             interest->target = 0;
01856     }
01857 }
01858 
01859 static void
01860 ccn_clean_all_interests(struct ccn *h)
01861 {
01862     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01863     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01864     struct interests_by_prefix *entry;
01865     for (hashtb_start(h->interests_by_prefix, e); e->data != NULL;) {
01866         entry = e->data;
01867         ccn_clean_interests_by_prefix(h, entry);
01868         if (entry->list == NULL)
01869             hashtb_delete(e);
01870         else
01871             hashtb_next(e);
01872     }
01873     hashtb_end(e);
01874 }
01875 
01876 static void
01877 ccn_notify_ccndid_changed(struct ccn *h)
01878 {
01879     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01880     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01881     if (h->interest_filters != NULL) {
01882         for (hashtb_start(h->interest_filters, e); e->data != NULL; hashtb_next(e)) {
01883             struct interest_filter *i = e->data;
01884             if ((i->flags & CCN_FORW_WAITING_CCNDID) != 0) {
01885                 i->expiry = h->now;
01886                 i->flags &= ~CCN_FORW_WAITING_CCNDID;
01887             }
01888         }
01889         hashtb_end(e);
01890     }
01891 }
01892 
01893 /**
01894  * Get the previously set event schedule from a ccn handle
01895  * @param h is the ccn handle
01896  * @returns pointer to the event schedule
01897  */
01898 struct ccn_schedule *
01899 ccn_get_schedule(struct ccn *h)
01900 {
01901     return(h->schedule);
01902 }
01903 
01904 /**
01905  * Set the event schedule in a ccn handle
01906  * @param h is the ccn handle
01907  * @param schedule is the new event schedule to be set in the handle
01908  * @returns pointer to the previous event schedule (or NULL)
01909  */
01910 struct ccn_schedule *
01911 ccn_set_schedule(struct ccn *h, struct ccn_schedule *schedule)
01912 {
01913     struct ccn_schedule *old = h->schedule;
01914     h->schedule = schedule;
01915     return(old);
01916 }
01917 
01918 /**
01919  * Process any scheduled operations that are due.
01920  * This is not used by normal ccn clients, but is made available for use
01921  * by ccnd to run its internal client.
01922  * @param h is the ccn handle.
01923  * @returns the number of microseconds until the next thing needs to happen.
01924  */
01925 int
01926 ccn_process_scheduled_operations(struct ccn *h)
01927 {
01928     struct hashtb_enumerator ee;
01929     struct hashtb_enumerator *e = &ee;
01930     struct interests_by_prefix *entry;
01931     struct expressed_interest *ie;
01932     int need_clean = 0;
01933     h->refresh_us = 5 * CCN_INTEREST_LIFETIME_MICROSEC;
01934     gettimeofday(&h->now, NULL);
01935     if (ccn_output_is_pending(h))
01936         return(h->refresh_us);
01937     h->running++;
01938     if (h->interest_filters != NULL) {
01939         for (hashtb_start(h->interest_filters, e); e->data != NULL; hashtb_next(e)) {
01940             struct interest_filter *i = e->data;
01941             if (tv_earlier(&i->expiry, &h->now)) {
01942                 /* registration is expiring, refresh it */
01943                 ccn_initiate_prefix_reg(h, e->key, e->keysize, i);
01944             }
01945             else
01946                 ccn_update_refresh_us(h, &i->expiry);
01947         }
01948         hashtb_end(e);
01949     }
01950     if (h->interests_by_prefix != NULL) {
01951         for (hashtb_start(h->interests_by_prefix, e); e->data != NULL; hashtb_next(e)) {
01952             entry = e->data;
01953             ccn_check_interests(entry->list);
01954             if (entry->list == NULL)
01955                 need_clean = 1;
01956             else {
01957                 for (ie = entry->list; ie != NULL; ie = ie->next) {
01958                     ccn_check_pub_arrival(h, ie);
01959                     if (ie->target != 0)
01960                         ccn_age_interest(h, ie, e->key, e->keysize);
01961                     if (ie->target == 0 && ie->wanted_pub == NULL) {
01962                         ccn_replace_handler(h, &(ie->action), NULL);
01963                         replace_interest_msg(ie, NULL);
01964                         need_clean = 1;
01965                     }
01966                 }
01967             }
01968         }
01969         hashtb_end(e);
01970         if (need_clean)
01971             ccn_clean_all_interests(h);
01972     }
01973     h->running--;
01974     return(h->refresh_us);
01975 }
01976 
01977 /**
01978  * Modify ccn_run timeout.
01979  *
01980  * This may be called from an upcall to change the timeout value.
01981  * Most often this will be used to set the timeout to zero so that
01982  * ccn_run() will return control to the client.
01983  * @param h is the ccn handle.
01984  * @param timeout is in milliseconds.
01985  * @returns old timeout value.
01986  */
01987 int
01988 ccn_set_run_timeout(struct ccn *h, int timeout)
01989 {
01990     int ans = h->timeout;
01991     h->timeout = timeout;
01992     return(ans);
01993 }
01994 
01995 /**
01996  * Run the ccn client event loop.
01997  * This may serve as the main event loop for simple apps by passing 
01998  * a timeout value of -1.
01999  * @param h is the ccn handle.
02000  * @param timeout is in milliseconds.
02001  * @returns a negative value for error, zero for success.
02002  */
02003 int
02004 ccn_run(struct ccn *h, int timeout)
02005 {
02006     struct timeval start;
02007     struct pollfd fds[1];
02008     int microsec;
02009     int s_microsec = -1;
02010     int millisec;
02011     int res = -1;
02012     if (h->running != 0)
02013         return(NOTE_ERR(h, EBUSY));
02014     memset(fds, 0, sizeof(fds));
02015     memset(&start, 0, sizeof(start));
02016     h->timeout = timeout;
02017     for (;;) {
02018         if (h->sock == -1) {
02019             res = -1;
02020             break;
02021         }
02022         if (h->schedule != NULL) {
02023             s_microsec = ccn_schedule_run(h->schedule);
02024         }
02025         microsec = ccn_process_scheduled_operations(h);
02026         if (s_microsec >= 0 && s_microsec < microsec)
02027             microsec = s_microsec;
02028         timeout = h->timeout;
02029         if (start.tv_sec == 0)
02030             start = h->now;
02031         else if (timeout >= 0) {
02032             millisec = (h->now.tv_sec  - start.tv_sec) *1000 +
02033             (h->now.tv_usec - start.tv_usec)/1000;
02034             if (millisec >= timeout) {
02035                 res = 0;
02036                 break;
02037             }
02038         }
02039         fds[0].fd = h->sock;
02040         fds[0].events = POLLIN;
02041         if (ccn_output_is_pending(h))
02042             fds[0].events |= POLLOUT;
02043         millisec = microsec / 1000;
02044         if (timeout >= 0 && timeout < millisec)
02045             millisec = timeout;
02046         res = poll(fds, 1, millisec);
02047         if (res < 0 && errno != EINTR) {
02048             res = NOTE_ERRNO(h);
02049             break;
02050         }
02051         if (res > 0) {
02052             if ((fds[0].revents | POLLOUT) != 0)
02053                 ccn_pushout(h);
02054             if ((fds[0].revents | POLLIN) != 0)
02055                 ccn_process_input(h);
02056         }
02057         if (h->err == ENOTCONN)
02058             ccn_disconnect(h);
02059         if (h->timeout == 0)
02060             break;
02061     }
02062     if (h->running != 0)
02063         abort();
02064     return((res < 0) ? res : 0);
02065 }
02066 
02067 /**
02068  * Instance data associated with handle_simple_incoming_content()
02069  */
02070 struct simple_get_data {
02071     struct ccn_closure closure;
02072     struct ccn_charbuf *resultbuf;
02073     struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pcobuf;
02074     struct ccn_indexbuf *compsbuf;
02075     int flags;
02076     int res;
02077 };
02078 
02079 /**
02080  * Upcall for implementing ccn_get()
02081  */
02082 static enum ccn_upcall_res
02083 handle_simple_incoming_content(
02084     struct ccn_closure *selfp,
02085     enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
02086     struct ccn_upcall_info *info)
02087 {
02088     struct simple_get_data *md = selfp->data;
02089     struct ccn *h = info->h;
02090 
02091     if (kind == CCN_UPCALL_FINAL) {
02092         if (selfp != &md->closure)
02093             abort();
02094         free(md);
02095         return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
02096     }
02097     if (kind == CCN_UPCALL_INTEREST_TIMED_OUT)
02098         return(selfp->intdata ? CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_REEXPRESS : CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
02099     if (kind == CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_UNVERIFIED) {
02100         if ((md->flags & CCN_GET_NOKEYWAIT) == 0)
02101             return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_VERIFY);
02102     }
02103     else if (kind == CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_KEYMISSING) {
02104         if ((md->flags & CCN_GET_NOKEYWAIT) == 0)
02105             return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_FETCHKEY);
02106     }
02107     else if (kind != CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT && kind != CCN_UPCALL_CONTENT_RAW)
02108         return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR);
02109     if (md->resultbuf != NULL) {
02110         md->resultbuf->length = 0;
02111         ccn_charbuf_append(md->resultbuf,
02112                            info->content_ccnb, info->pco->offset[CCN_PCO_E]);
02113     }
02114     if (md->pcobuf != NULL)
02115         memcpy(md->pcobuf, info->pco, sizeof(*md->pcobuf));
02116     if (md->compsbuf != NULL) {
02117         md->compsbuf->n = 0;
02118         ccn_indexbuf_append(md->compsbuf,
02119                             info->content_comps->buf, info->content_comps->n);
02120     }
02121     md->res = 0;
02122     ccn_set_run_timeout(h, 0);
02123     return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
02124 }
02125 
02126 /**
02127  * Get a single matching ContentObject
02128  * This is a convenience for getting a single matching ContentObject.
02129  * Blocks until a matching ContentObject arrives or there is a timeout.
02130  * @param h is the ccn handle. If NULL or ccn_get is called from inside
02131  *        an upcall, a new connection will be used and upcalls from other
02132  *        requests will not be processed while ccn_get is active.
02133  * @param name holds a ccnb-encoded Name
02134  * @param interest_template conveys other fields to be used in the interest
02135  *        (may be NULL).
02136  * @param timeout_ms limits the time spent waiting for an answer (milliseconds).
02137  * @param resultbuf is updated to contain the ccnb-encoded ContentObject.
02138  * @param pcobuf may be supplied to save the client the work of re-parsing the
02139  *        ContentObject; may be NULL if this information is not actually needed.
02140  * @param compsbuf works similarly.
02141  * @param flags - CCN_GET_NOKEYWAIT means that it is permitted to return
02142  *        unverified data.
02143  * @returns 0 for success, -1 for an error.
02144  */
02145 int
02146 ccn_get(struct ccn *h,
02147         struct ccn_charbuf *name,
02148         struct ccn_charbuf *interest_template,
02149         int timeout_ms,
02150         struct ccn_charbuf *resultbuf,
02151         struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject *pcobuf,
02152         struct ccn_indexbuf *compsbuf,
02153         int flags)
02154 {
02155     struct ccn *orig_h = h;
02156     struct hashtb *saved_keys = NULL;
02157     int res;
02158     struct simple_get_data *md;
02159 
02160     if ((flags & ~((int)CCN_GET_NOKEYWAIT)) != 0)
02161         return(-1);
02162     if (h == NULL || h->running) {
02163         h = ccn_create();
02164         if (h == NULL)
02165             return(-1);
02166         if (orig_h != NULL) { /* Dad, can I borrow the keys? */
02167             saved_keys = h->keys;
02168             h->keys = orig_h->keys;
02169         }
